title: Palma de Mallorca
summary: Palma (Catalan: [ˈpalmə]; Spanish: [ˈpalma]; officially known as Palma de Mallorca 1983–88, 2006–08, 2012–16)[3] is the capital and largest city of the autonomous community of the Balearic Islands in Spain.[4] It is situated on the south coast of Mallorca on the Bay of Palma. The Cabrera Archipelago, though widely separated from Palma proper, is administratively considered part of the municipality. As of 2018, Palma Airport serves over 29 million passengers per year.
